body: I wonder if having a shortcut or button to go to the next non-labelled entry would be useful.

That would not be so useful as it wouldn't account for "correct non-labeled" entries, the entries that doesn't contain any NER tag. Some way to keep track of what has not been handled, or the ability to mark as correct without labels would be necessary.

issue.title: Enhancement/Remember labeling progress

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
This pull request implements a small improvement to the labeling view: the labeling view now remembers the current page by syncing the current query offset to the URL fragment.

This enables "deep linking" where a user who's doing a labeling session could bookmark the current page and later resume work from where they stopped. See also https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/58.

Ideally the feature would use [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) instead of the custom fragment manipulation, but that would be a bigger change so for now I wanted to minimize the amount of new code.

Screenshot showing offset state in URL:

[![Screenshot showing offset state in URL](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086421/51856321-6e0e1e00-22fd-11e9-8420-1204b8a3d3b7.png)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086421/51856321-6e0e1e00-22fd-11e9-8420-1204b8a3d3b7.png)

issue.title: Pagination (Enhancement)

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body: For large numbers of documents some sort of pagination at the bottom of the left navigation area would be useful.  For example pagination like: < 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 > would be helpful.  It can be difficult for users to resume annotating a couple of hundred annotations in.

body:
Usually, there are three kinds of roles in annotations process: 

A) Labeler: The labeler is responsible for marking the data.

B) Auditor: The auditor is responsible for reviewing the quality of the marked data.

C) Administrator: Manage personnel, issue tasks, and count wages.

Right now we assume `Administrator` also play the `Auditor` role. So As @c-w mentioned, it might be acceptable to add a button jump to next non-audited entry. 

- Convenience for Labeler: `next non-labeled entry` button 
- Convenience for Auditor: `next non-audited/checked entry` button

issue.title: Feature: Implement me API

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Currently, when checking whether the user is a superuser or not, or showing the username, it depends on the Django context.

This PR adds `me API`, which returns the user information. For using this API, we will be able to reduce the dependency.

Me API can return information like follows:

```
{
    "id": 1,
    "username": "hironsan",
    "first_name": "",
    "last_name": "",
    "email": "",
    "is_superuser": true
}
```

issue.title: Enhancement/Go to annotation page

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Currently a user can go to the previous annotation item and the next annotation item. There are 5 annotation items per page so if the user wants to go to a item in the middle of a long project, they may have to do a lot of clicks.

In order to improve the user experience, this pull request implements a new navigation that lets the user quickly jump to a specific annotation page.

This feature was requested by a number of users, including @axelinternet and @bwkchee.

The animation below shows the behavior of the new navigation element. The animation demonstrates navigating to a particular page as well as protection against too low and too high inputs:

![Animation showing the new go to page feature](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086421/57649247-b512dd00-7595-11e9-8ff2-69cc30b3cb38.gif)

Resolves https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/58
Resolves https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/issues/84

body: This is quite problematic for labeling/auditing large datasets. At the very least some indication in the url would be really helpful. Thanks!

@olix20 Note that the page information is stored in the URL so it's possible to resume long auditing sessions via bookmarking (see screenshot below):

![Screenshot showing annotation page information in URL](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086421/58256113-63f4ad00-7d3c-11e9-94cc-4f30f226971e.png)

Thanks @c-w but that `offset=x` doesn't appear on my chrome: `http://localhost:8000/projects/6/#` 
I import data in conll format and have a few hundred prelabelled sentences (auditing).

I tried it: you'd have to force refresh the page with `offset` query to see the left pane change. also no indication what the current index is to use for next time.
@olix20 What's the version of the project you're using? Do you see any errors in the Javascript console?
@c-w I don't see errors in the console. how do i check the version? I just pulled and built but still same error. thanks.

issue.title: Feature request: choose where to start annotation

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
### System information
- Windows 10
- Python Version: 3.6 

### Describe the problem
Hi, I think it should be possible to indicate at which document we want to resume annotation. For example, I have a dataset of several thousands articles and cannot annotate them all at once, and when I quit Doccano then come back it just brings me on the first document.

Hence I think that either Doccano should automatically restart on the last document you annotated, or that is should allow us to indicate a number at which we want to start.

Thanks!
